title: 108_s1193
content: The Act titled "Capital Construction Fund Qualified Withdrawal Act of 2003" encourages the retirement of certain fishing vessels and permits under the Merchant Marine Act of 1936. The Merchant Marine Act of 1936 is amended to allow modifications to agreements for the sustainability of US fisheries by making capital construction fund withdrawals qualified if related fishing vessels and permits are retired in exchange. The Merchant Marine Act of 1936 is amended to allow modifications to agreements for the sustainability of US fisheries by making capital construction fund withdrawals qualified if related fishing vessels and permits are retired in exchange. Amendments include changes to vessel definitions and industry fee payments under the Magnuson-Stevens Fishery Conservation and Management Act. The curr_chunk discusses various eligible uses for funds in relation to vessels operated in US fisheries, including rollover contributions to individual retirement plans, payments from vessel sales, acquisition of vessel monitoring systems for safety, and acquisition or construction of fishing gear to minimize bycatch. The curr_chunk discusses amendments to the Magnuson-Stevens Fishery Conservation and Management Act related to the sale of retired agreement vessels or fishing permits through a reduction program. The curr_chunk amends the Magnuson-Stevens Fishery Conservation and Management Act to ensure retirement of vessels and permits for qualified withdrawals. It also includes conforming amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The curr_chunk amends the Magnuson-Stevens Fishery Conservation and Management Act by specifying payment details for industry fees and rollover contributions related to fishing capacity reduction programs. The curr_chunk specifies allowable uses for funds from fishing capacity reduction programs, including contributions to individual retirement plans, sale proceeds for retiring fishing vessels, vessel monitoring systems, and fishing gear to minimize bycatch. The curr_chunk amends the tax code to include the sale of fishing permits retired through capacity reduction programs as allowable uses for funds. The curr_chunk states that the Secretary of the Treasury will establish procedures to ensure that funds withdrawn for specific purposes are used for retiring fishing vessels and permits. The effective date for these amendments is after the enactment of the Act.
